question: At the micropyle end is the egg apparatus consisting of two synergids and one ___ cell.
At the chalazal end are three ___ in the embryo sac.
The large central cell in the embryo sac contains two ___ nuclei.
Pollination transfers pollen grains from the ___ to the stigma.
Pollinating agents can be abiotic or ___ in nature.
Abiotic pollinating agents include wind and ___.
Biotic pollinating agents include ___.
Pollen-pistil interaction starts with the landing of pollen grains on the ___.
Pollen tube entry occurs when pollen is ___ with the pistil.
Incompatible pollen results in pollen ___.
After compatible pollination, pollen grain germinates on the ___.
Pollen tube grows through the ___ to reach the ovule.
The pollen tube discharges two male gametes into one of the ___.
Two fusion events in each embryo sac is termed ___ fertilisation.
Syngamy results in formation of a diploid ___.
Triple fusion produces a triploid ___ endosperm nucleus.
The triploid primary endosperm nucleus is located in the ___ endosperm cell.
Zygote develops into the ___.
The primary endosperm cell forms the ___ tissue.
Formation of endosperm always precedes development of the ___.
The first stage of embryo development is the ___ stage.
The embryo passes through the proembryo, globular and ___-shaped stages.
Mature dicotyledonous embryo has two ___.
The embryonal axis has epicotyl and ___.
Monocotyledonous embryos have a single ___.
After fertilisation, ovary develops into ___.
After fertilisation, ovules develop into ___.
Formation of seeds without fertilisation is called ___.
Apomixis is common in some angiosperms, particularly in ___.
Apomicts have advantages in horticulture and ___.
Some angiosperms produce more than one embryo in their seed, called ___.
Egg apparatus consists of two synergids and one ___ cell.
The micropylar tip of synergids has a ___ apparatus.
Double fertilisation includes syngamy and ___ fusion.
Syngamy involves fusion of male gamete with ___.
Triple fusion involves fusion with two ___ nuclei.
Endosperm development precedes ___ development.
Ovary develops into fruit and ovules into ___.
Polyembryony means more than one ___ in a seed.
Pollen tube grows through style and enters ___.
Primary endosperm cell forms ___ tissue.
Epicotyl and hypocotyl are parts of the ___ axis.
